tool.name: tool_4
tool.displayname: Overland Flow Distance to Channel Network

param.name: ELEVATION
param.dialogReference:
Elevation

Grid, input

A grid that contains elevation data.

param.name: CHANNELS
param.dialogReference:
Channel Network

Grid, input

A grid providing information about the channel network. It is assumed that no-data cells are not part of the channel network. Vice versa all others cells are recognised as channel network members.

param.name: ROUTE
param.dialogReference:
Preferred Routing

Grid, input, optional

optional

Downhill flow is bound to preferred routing cells, where these are not no-data. Helps to model e.g. small ditches, that are not well represented in the elevation data.

param.name: DISTANCE
param.dialogReference:
Overland Flow Distance

Grid, output

The overland flow distance in map units. It is assumed that the (vertical) elevation data use the same units as the (horizontal) grid coordinates.

param.name: DISTVERT
param.dialogReference:
Vertical Overland Flow Distance

Grid, output

This is the vertical component of the overland flow

param.name: DISTHORZ
param.dialogReference:
Horizontal Overland Flow Distance

Grid, output

This is the horizontal component of the overland flow

param.name: TIME
param.dialogReference:
Flow Travel Time

Grid, output, optional

optional

flow travel time to channel expressed in hours based on Manning's Equation

param.name: SDR
param.dialogReference:
Sediment Yield Delivery Ratio

Grid, output, optional

optional

This is the horizontal component of the overland flow

param.name: FIELDS
param.dialogReference:
Fields

Grid, input, optional

optional

If set, output is given about the number of fields a flow path visits downhill. For D8 only.

param.name: PASSES
param.dialogReference:
Fields Visited

Grid, output

Number of fields a flow path visits downhill starting at a cell. For D8 only.

param.name: METHOD
param.dialogReference:
Flow Algorithm

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] D8

[1] MFD

Default: 1

Choose a flow routing algorithm that shall be used for the overland flow distance calculation:

- D8

- MFD

param.name: BOUNDARY
param.dialogReference:
Boundary Cells

Boolean

Default: 0

Take cells at the boundary of the DEM as channel.

param.name: FLOW_B
param.dialogReference:
Beta

Floating point

Minimum: 0.000000

Default: 1.000000

catchment specific parameter for sediment delivery ratio calculation

param.name: FLOW_K
param.dialogReference:
Manning-Strickler Coefficient

Grid, input, optional

optional

Manning-Strickler coefficient for flow travel time estimation (reciprocal of Manning's Roughness Coefficient)

param.name: FLOW_K_DEFAULT
param.dialogReference:
Default

Floating point

Minimum: 0.000000

Default: 20.000000

default value if no grid has been selected

param.name: FLOW_R
param.dialogReference:
Flow Depth

Grid, input, optional

optional

flow depth [m] for flow travel time estimation

param.name: FLOW_R_DEFAULT
param.dialogReference:
Default

Floating point

Minimum: 0.000000

Default: 0.050000

default value if no grid has been selected

tool.summary: This tool calculates overland flow distances to a channel network based on gridded digital elevation data and channel network information. The flow algorithm may be either Deterministic 8 (O'Callaghan & Mark 1984) or Multiple Flow Direction (Freeman 1991). Sediment Delivery Rates (SDR) according to Ali & De Boer (2010) can be computed optionally.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Conrad, O., Bechtel, B., Bock, M., Dietrich, H., Fischer, E., Gerlitz, L., Wehberg, J., Wichmann, V., and Boehner, J. (2015): System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses (SAGA) v. 2.1.4, Geosci. Model Dev., 8, 1991-2007, doi:10.5194/gmd-8-1991-2015. [SAGA - System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses - saga-gis.org]
